intro: Dorstenia socotrana, commonly known as the Socotra starwood, is a unique plant native to the Socotra Archipelago. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid conditions of its native habitat. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in spring. Dorstenia socotrana is notable for its ecological significance and is considered a relict species with evolutionary adaptations to its harsh environment.
